title: Description of the Project
heading: ROBOTIC PROCESS AUTOMATION (RPA)
subtitle: Automating the monthly bill generation of CDBL through RPA using UIPath
content:
This program generates PDF of bill and renames its filename for each DP automatically by varying the DPID, bill_month and bill_date string of a web link in a loop, from a recipient list of DP IDs (usually about 400 entries) in spreadsheet file, and also splits Bill PDF into individual pages or range of pages and renames each of them according to spreadsheet data. This eased off the workload of assigned person as only bill date and period is entered once and the rest is done by the program, unlike previously where the person had to repeat the process of entering ID of a DP (Depository Participant) and bill info to Oracle based software and then renaming the generated file hundred of times for all DPs.
View a demo of RPA sequence of the project
Go to the Github repo of this project
technology: The sequence is implemented using UIPath Studio and the custom input page is made using HTML and Javascript.
role: I solely developed this program for CDBL after finding out that generating bills required repetitive manual input and manipulation.

title: Description of the Project
heading: NEW OFFICIAL WEBSITE OF CDBL
subtitle: A redesigned facelift of Official Website of CDBL featuring dynamic and responsive pages
content:
A new official website of CDBL (www.cdbl.com.bd) built from the ground up for the modern web and devices which is dynamic and responsive with real-time data presentation and less amount of navigation, while keeping the actions as consistent as before so visitors do not have to face steep learning curves. Notable features include:

  • Responsive and Dynamic Contents for fast performance, better maintainability and seamless adaptability with devices of any screen size, irrespective of its platform.
  • Better organization of news â€“ separate Corporate Actions, Special News and Events.
  • All banners collected in one place in a Carousel.
  • Built-in Search input for searching the whole website.
  • Scroller for better accessibility of top news
  • Events calendar
  • Frequently asked questions all in one place.
  • News article shown like online news portal with related news of same issuer, or same type of news (special/event) whichever applies.
  • List of DPs filterable via buttons (tabs) with dedicated list search and also sortable.
  • List of ISINs and Issuers with dedicated list search and also sortable.
  • A page for CDBL operating instructions.
  • Photo Gallery with live photo viewer.
  • Historical view of each market/CDBL stat, like market value, etc.
  • More CDBL statistics.
  • One-click register and login button at Navbar.
  • View location of CDBL Head Office with Google Maps.
  • Complete redesign of account details page to show all information, both holding and transaction records on the same page interchangeable by using tabs.
technology: HTML, CSS (Bootstrap 4), Javascript (JQuery), AJAX, PHP (Vanilla, PDO connection), MySQL
role: I solely developed the frontend, including UI/UX design and created new MySQL tables in addition to importing previous website's database, and also the basic PDO connection, while the PHP coding was done by me and my Head together.

title: Description of the Project
heading: CUSTOMER COMPLAINT ADDRESS MODULE (CCAM)
subtitle: A Platform to centrally address investor complaints by Unifying all Participants of the Capital Market
content:
CCAM - short for Customer Complaint Address Module, is an online Module to address complaints of the customers of the Capital Market, developed by CDBL for Bangladesh Securities and Exchange Commission. This application is used by every institution so that any complaint against an institution can be viewed by the corresponding institution directly and take necessary actions, which is notified to the customer. Precisely, CCAM is a multi-user platform that allows investors (customers) to file complaint about any Broker, Exchange, Issuer and Merchant Bank (institution) and respective entity settles it quickly using the same platform. The customer can also track status of his complaints and appeal if the conclusion is not satisfactory. This results is significantly fast resolve of complaints, transparency and immediate acknowledgement of complaint submission.
Go to CCAM
role: For CCAM, I designed the interface of Public Stats page using bootstrap and also learned about its levels of operation and flow of processes.

title: Description of the Project
heading: MICROSOFT SHAREPOINT DEPLOYMENT
subtitle: Setting up DSE with Microsoft SharePoint for Enabling Collaboration between its Employees
content: Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) decided to use Microsoft SharePoint as their tool for communication and collaboration between its employees, as DSE already has its email and people directory set up with Microsoft Exchange. During my internship, the project just got approval from top management and steps were taken to seek deployment assistance from Microsoft.
technology: SharePoint is a web-based collaborative platform where clients of a domain powered by MS Exchange Server can log in to collaborate; for example, by managing documents.
role: I observed how the IT infrastructure department was communicating with top management and Microsoft through emails and its approach for the project. I also suggested deploying Microsoft Teams instead as the latter is basically Exchange Server, SharePoint and Skype combined into a single solution, which would increase productivity and omit extra tools.

title: Description of the Project
heading: SIP ASSET MANAGEMENT WEBAPP
subtitle: Invest Money and Get Better Returns through Systematic Investment Plan using this Webapp
content:
A mobile friendly and responsive Progressive Web Application solution that can be used by an Asset Management Company to simplify the process of registering and managing portfolio of Systematic Investment Plan so that investors will be able to conveniently carry out all the essential activities related to Systematic Investment Plan, anywhere as long as they are connected online. The overall system is designed into two main parts, the customer interface (link below) and Admin Panel. The customer panel should be able to interact very friendly with the customer on whatever device she is on. This internal part consists of few features, which enables the customer to get the maximum service from her investment. The Admin Panel is designed for Asset Manager. It contains all the controls needed to provided operations that are usually done by the asset manager. Whatever the asset manager does is updated on the customer interface via the backend MySQL database.
Features of this system:

  • Account System: Customer can sign in to his personalized account and have a quick glance of useful information, like his schemes and its details, profile, etc.
  • Return Predictor: Redemption value can be estimated after a given tenure with given return rate and balance (investment amount). This value includes both capital gain and dividend return.
  • Adding Scheme: Since a customer can have multiple mutual funds, she can add schemes in her account. The aggregate of the value of each fund/scheme is subject to changes depending on the unit price (NAV) of the fund. Each scheme is identified by asset manager via registration key and is associated with respective customer.
  • Admin Panel: This is the page for asset manager which is used to update the information of mutual funds, acknowledge payment, buy/sell units of a mutual fund, and view a user's information and the user's scheme.

Scientific paper of this project was published on Computer Systems Science and Engineering Journal of Tech Science Press which can be read here. Download the project report here.

title: Description of the Project
heading: NEELAM: AN AUCTION SITE
subtitle: An E-commerce Website that lets anyone Sell Item at Auction and Buy Item by Bidding
content:
Neelam is an auction site, like eBay. It makes items available for a limited time in which a base price is set for the item and interested buyers place bids. After the time is over only the person who placed the highest bid could buy the item. It is kept intuitive and minimalistic as possible so that everyone will be able to use it to find items quickly. It has an account system for users and a review system for the items. Users will be able to both buy and sell items, bridging the imbalance of people trying to discard an item and people wanting the same item.

title: Description of the Project
heading: SECRET BOT: A BLUETOOTH CONTROLLED SPY ROBOT
subtitle: A Tactical Vehicle controlled by android device that can send real-time stream
content:
Secret Bot: A Bluetooth Controlled Spy Robot is an Arduino Uno based robot that can be monitored and controlled by an Android device using an Android application. The Wireless Network Camera mounted on the robot can also be displayed on any other Android/iOS device for monitoring. In this project simple materials are used like plastic wood for the chassis, cycle spokes for the wheel axle, L293D motor driver and two 600 rpm DC motors for propulsion in four directions namely front, reverse, left and right. Bluetooth module HC-05 is used to receive commands in the form of strings from the Android application. The robot is covered with camouflage texture so that it does not alert surroundings. It is made up of simple materials rather than preassembled kits because the materials are readily and cheaply available, the robot becomes very lightweight and it can be formed into any desired size. The July 2016 Dhaka Attack was the inspiration to make this robot which can assist law enforcers to take action against terrorists.

This project was accepted for ICICSA 2018 Conference at Thailand and Scientific paper of this project was published on IJPAM Journal which can be read here. Download the project report here.
technology: C++ (Arduino IDE), Bluetooth API (Remote Control), ONVIF SDK (IP Camera)
role: I solely designed and developed the robot including hardware and software, and the idea was concieved by my faculty supervisor, for my university's CSE299 Junior Design Project.

title: Description of the Project
heading: OBSTRUCTION DETECTING ROBOT
subtitle: A Robot that Navigates using a Given Map while sensing any obstruction
content: This is an Arduino Uno based obstruction-detecting robot which first moves forward for 10 sec, then left for 10 sec, then right for 10 sec, then stops. If there is any obstacle in its way, the robot do not move until the obstacle is removed. Obstacle is detected by the robot's HC-SR04 ultrasound sensor such that if distance between obstacle and sensor is less than 4 cm the DC motors will stop.
role: I solely designed and developed this robot, including both its hardware and software, for my university's CSE331 Microprocessor Interfacing Project.
